Detoxification

Hepatocytes metabolise foreign, excess or toxic substances into substances the body can excrete. For instance:

  • Ammonia – Is a waste product of protein breakdown. The liver converts it into urea and excretes it through the kidneys.
  • Bilirubin – Is a waste product of hemoglobin breakdown and a part of bile excretion.

Medications and other recreational substances (alcohol, caffeine and nicotine) are also metabolised, inactivated, and excreted with bile or urine by the hepatocytes. However, certain substances cannot be processed by the liver and are thus stored in the hepatocytes.
